comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Mrs. Howe appears to be Margaret Vale Howe (b. 1878) also seen here (different event): [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3030264486/] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3277066776/] en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Margaret_Vale Mrs. Elmer Black was Madeleine Powell Black, chair of the American Peace and Arbitration League, frequently attending peace events at the international level; author of "Civilize the Nations" (1911). catalog.hathitrust.org/Record/009009125 Mrs. Walston Brown was Eva Robert Ingersoll Brown (b. 1863); there's a photo of her younger, here: www.rgimuseum.org/ItemView.php?ItemID=101&ViewID=15 Mrs. Marion Burritt was actually Miss Marion T. Burritt, a Smith College graduate who was involved in the New York Peace Society.

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: pennylrichardsca:  Thanks for providing us with the full names for some of the women shown in this picture.  We'll include some of this information next time we update.
